item.title: The real cost of air pollution in India
item.description: 13 of the world’s 20 most polluted cities are in India. 1 in 5 deaths here are linked to air pollution. The economic damage is $95 billion per year, but this number probably doesn’t capture all the first and second-order effects. Premature deaths due to pollution are wiping out decades of earning potential. It has various downstream implications: lower working hours, lost earning potential, children missing school, stress on healthcare systems, and, not to mention, the disproportionate impact on the poor and vulnerable.
